column3: No opinion on which of the alternatives to choose, but the  Qt code change looks fairly trivially correct.

### Conflicts

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the confl

utACK 3dd3da68dc738970a3d1276a738b3d59d88510a2. If this fixes the problem, it seems like the simplest solution that doesn't require messing with the build system or changing compilers at the last minute.
Concept ACK: this fix seems less intrusive than the alternatives :)

~~@achow101 I tried to cherry-pick this to 0.21 branch but it's not quite a clean backport. Many conflicts in `depends/packages/qt.mk`. Mind opening a PR for the 0.21 branch as well?~~\n\nEdit: no idea if I got the order right but see #20479.

Can you add the relevant explanations to your patch file. Feel free to take any wording from [mine](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20440/commits/9276fe0216b05ec1bb2f68f6fa5fd517ba192cdb#diff-4f7c9172d8df0551d78b82b36f153091fbf71d742bab5431b7d8a16f068a1380). Also mention when the patch can be dropped.
The patch file could be applied for the 0.21 branch only, no?
